title: Perry on Japan - significance of purpose

content.prompt: The excerpt best supports the conclusion that in the 1850s, the United States government

choices.label: sought to prevent Japan from forming a naval alliance with the British empire
was willing to intimidate Asian countries like Japan to secure economic opportunities
attempted to monopolize Japanese commerce and to exclude the participation of Europeans in trade
was interested in making the government of Japan more democratic

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the significance of a source's point of view, purpose, historical situation, and/or audience, including how these might limit the use(s) of a source.
